title: How to make a map like Google Maps - Quora

response.answer_text: Companies like Pitney-Bowes and Rok Technologies sell the geographic data and software necessary to produce maps. That can get very expensive, and the data changes constantly so regular updates are a must. So unless you have very specific requirements to have your own infrastructure it would be best and cheapest to offload all of that to a specialty service such as Google or Bing, a third open source, and quite excellent solution is “open street maps”. If you really want to dig into the trenches and you have all the time in the world, you can attain raw map data from the USGS get it into a consistent data format then use an open source tool such as SharpMap to render the database data into a map.

Google maps is a 12 year project,backed by the giant Google.Even if you want a start a project like this from scratch,you will need data from Google. If what you want is really a personalised version of GMaps,you can use the Maps API to do that,save time and effort
